p: Under contemporary environmental and management conditions, the population was stable over the 100‚Äêyear simulation period (Table 2), with a mean annual abundance of ca. 2,500 males (Figure 5). Under contemporary environmental and management conditions, 4.9% of simulations resulted in a population that fell below the management target of 1,000 males, but no simulations fell below the critical threshold of 200 males.
